p: Zoonoses are the infections that are naturally transmitted between vertebrate animals and humans [ 3]. The link between animals and human populations is very close in regions where peoples retain traditional lifestyles. Such contact, especially in absence of proper care can lead to a serious risk to public health with great economic consequences. Zoonotic diseases may occur through direct contact with the animal, through vectors, or water or food contamination [ 4]. Zoonoses constitute a diverse group of viral, bacterial, fungal, and parasitic diseases.
